subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han simp|𩠐|f=巛|t=丷}}. Originally {{liushu|p|nocap=1|adj=1}}. In the oracle bone script, it appeared with or without hair ({{zh-l|*巛}}), but {{zh-l|*𩠐}}, the form with hair, was the form that was perpetuated.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*k-lu}}; cognate with {{cog|lus|lu||head}}. This word has also been compared with {{cog|map-pro|*qulu|*quluh|head}} ({{cog|ms|hulu}}) and {{cog|tai-pro|*krawᶜ|*klawᶜ ~ krawᶜ|head; hair knot}} ({{cog|th|เกล้า||hair; head}}), and was used by Sagart to support his {{w|Sino-Austronesian languages|Sino-Austronesian hypothesis}}. Compare {{och-l|道|path, road}} (with the same phonetic component) and its relationship with {{cog|hmx-pro|*kləuX||road, way}}.

This word was replaced by {{och-l|頭|head}} by the {{w|Warring States}} period, possibly due to early homophony with {{och-l|手|hand}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[report]] someone to the authorities
# to plead guilty
# to [[face]] (a direction)
